khemavatī： khemavatī（thī）
ခေမဝတီ（ထီ）
[khema+vantu+ī]
[ခေမ+ဝန္တု+ဤ]

Khemavatī：1．Khemavatī．-The capital of King Khemankara and the birthplace of Kakusandha （D．ii．7； Bu．xxii．13； BuA．209； Dvy．242）．It is sometimes called Khema．E．g．，J．i．42．

2．Khemavatī．-The city of birth of Tissa Buddha （Bu．xviii．16）．There he preached the Buddhavamsa to his relatives （BuA．190）．It is sometimes also called Khema and Khemaka．

khemavatī：ခေမဝတီ （ထီ）
[ခေမ+ဝန္တု+ဤ]
ဘေးမဲ့မြို့၊ ငြိမ်းချမ်းရေးမြို့၊ ခေမဝတီမြို့။ ခေမ，ခေမက-လည်းကြည့်။
